alert.note: Alert for Central Horry; Marion; Northern Horry (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 04 at 1:12PM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Horry and south central Marion Counties through 145 PM EST... At 111 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms extending from near Horry to near Pee Dee Crossroads to near Dongola. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Locations impacted include... Conway, Red Hill, Horry, Hickory Grove, Homewood, Horry Georgetown Technical College Conway Campus, Adrian, Pee Dee Crossroads, Brittons Neck, Nixonville, Dongola, Hammond, Coastal Carolina University, Bayboro, Allsbrook, Lighthouse Care Center Of Conway and Conway Medical Center. This includes SC Highway 22 between mile markers 1 and 22. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 PM EST for northeastern South Carolina.
